entities.name: Condition
entities.description: A condition is a Boolean condition that is true or false.

entities.name: Undesired condition
entities.description:
An undesired condition is a condition that desrcibes a state or an issue that is harmful, unsafe, or detracts from the goal.
 An undesired condition describes a risk.

entities.name: Desired condition
entities.description:
A "desired condition" is a condition that desrcibes an state that is benefical, safe, and supports the goal.
 A "desired condition" describes a goal or a sub-goal that contributes to achieving the goal.

entities.name: Concept in Condition
entities.description:
A "concept in condition" is part of a condition.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a property of a PPR Asset.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a value or value range.
 A "concept in condition" is measurable.
 An "equivalence class" is a value range.

entities.name: Treatment of a Condition
entities.description:
A Treatment of a Condition shall adapt or improve an undesired condition to make a desired condition more likely.
 A Treatment of a Condition shall adapt or improve an undesired condition to avoid the undesired condition.
 A Treatment of a Condition shall adapt or improve an undesired condition to mitgate the effect of an undesired condition.

entities.name: PPR Asset
entities.description:
A "PPR Asset" is a product, process, or resource asset.
 A "PPR Asset" is a product, process, or resource that is important for a stakeholder.

entities.name: Product
entities.description:
A product typically is the output of a process.
 A product typically is the input to a process.
 A product is a "PPR Asset".

entities.name: Process
entities.description:
A process shall transform input products into output products.
 A process may require resources to execute the transformation.
 A process may have sub-processes that describe parts of the process.
 A process often is a "PPR Asset".

entities.name: Resource
entities.description:
A resource is a system, component, controller, or actor that executes a process.
 A resource is a system, component, or controller that autmates a process.

entities.name: Task
entities.description:
A task shall describe an activity that a system or an actor shall conduct.
 A task is a process that has no sub-processes.

entities.name: PPR Property
entities.description:
A "PPR Property" is a property of a "PPR Asset".
 A "PPR Property" describes a numerical value, text or data structure.

entities.name: System
entities.description:
A system is a resource.
 A system may consist of components and controllers.

entities.name: Component
entities.description:
A component is a resource.
 A component is part of a system.
 A component may consist of components.

entities.name: Controller
entities.description:
A controller is a resource.
 A controller automates a component or a system.

entities.name: Actor
entities.description:
An actor is a resource.
 An actor is in general a human.
 An actor may use computer functions.
 An actor may use a controller to control a component or a system.
 An actor may use several controllers.
 An actor operates or maintains systems, components, or controllers to conduct a process.

entities.name: Warning
entities.description: A warning indicates an undesired condition.

relations.name: Condition has Condition Concept
relations.description: The relation "Condition has Condition Concept" links a "Condition Concept" to a "Condition", where the "Condition Concept" is a concept of the condition.

source.name: Concept in Condition
source.description:
A "concept in condition" is part of a condition.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a property of a PPR Asset.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a value or value range.
 A "concept in condition" is measurable.
 An "equivalence class" is a value range.

target.name: Condition
target.description: A condition is a Boolean condition that is true or false.

relations.name: Condition Concept is related to a PPR property
relations.description: The relation "Condition Concept is related to a PPR property" links a "Condition Concept" to a "PPR property", where the "PPR property" describes the "Condition Concept".

source.name: Concept in Condition
source.description:
A "concept in condition" is part of a condition.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a property of a PPR Asset.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a value or value range.
 A "concept in condition" is measurable.
 An "equivalence class" is a value range.

target.name: PPR Property
target.description:
A "PPR Property" is a property of a "PPR Asset".
 A "PPR Property" describes a numerical value, text or data structure.

relations.name: PPR Asset has a a PPR property
relations.description: The relation "PPR Asset has a a PPR property" links a "PPR Asset" to a "PPR property", where the "PPR property" describes a property of the "PPR Asset".

source.name: PPR Property
source.description:
A "PPR Property" is a property of a "PPR Asset".
 A "PPR Property" describes a numerical value, text or data structure.

target.name: PPR Asset
target.description:
A "PPR Asset" is a product, process, or resource asset.
 A "PPR Asset" is a product, process, or resource that is important for a stakeholder.

relations.name: Condition contributes to Condition
relations.description:
The relation "Condition contributes to Condition" links two conditions, where the first condition contributes to the second contribution.
 In a relation "Condition contributes to Condition" the outcome of the second contribution depends on the state or outcome of the first condition.

source.name: Condition
source.description: A condition is a Boolean condition that is true or false.

target.name: Condition
target.description: A condition is a Boolean condition that is true or false.

relations.name: Condition Concept is related to a PPR asset
relations.description: The relation "Condition Concept is related to a PPR asset" links a "Condition Concept" to a "PPR asset", where the "PPR asset" describes the "Condition Concept".

 A "concept in condition" may describe a property of a PPR Asset.
 A "concept in condition" may describe a value or value range.
 A "concept in condition" is measurable.
 An "equivalence class" is a value range.

 A "PPR Asset" is a product, process, or resource that is important for a stakeholder.
